topic.title: Should I put the ClassCoder ZeroProxy on HTTPS?
topic.body: Since Let's Encrypt came out recently, should I put my ZeroProxy on HTTPS?

1_1C7rjaNpWFAtWbQgSxbGaPzBdgCA47VYc6.body: Just so you know, I'm working on this right now, so I'm going to default to yes ;)
Well, I got a yes so I did it!

> [dividedby0](#comment_13_16iYwD5U2fNoS22p6447J7992iL3DHjSHY): Yes! Was looking forward to one of the ZeroNet proxies getting HTTPS. Is there any way HTTPS could be implemented for ZeroNet itself?

@nofish?

3_168qV1Xxp2EyszrzdECLUwXrn9wGYjDdar.body: FYI if you want a free peer, go to your site over my proxy and it'll seed. That should prevent "no peer found" errors.

1_1MBZrgSwMQMRnMFjQkw2JpwdWRaKo7Eb55.body: zeronet.classcoder.com is now HTTPS. Might want to replace the link in the OP.
